content.description: Crux move is getting off the first fern-filled ledge.  Hands aren't great, you just need to trust a high, smeared foot, but the rock is so slabby and has great friction, so it's just mental.
content.protection:
Used cams and offset nuts.  The crack is mostly flared, but finding bomber placements isn't hard.  A little run-out at the top, but at that point the climb is probably 5.0 or 5.1 

  No fixed gear, but a decent tree at the top to anchor and rappel off.  Or climb above the anchor tree to walk off and bushwhack back to the trail.
content.location: See picture for the route on the wall.  Rappel down or climb above the anchor tree and walk off.

content.description:
Easy slab wall with numerous lines in the 5.1 to 5.3 range.  There's good friction on the rock, and solid hands and feet. Mediocre pro placements due to flared cracks. 

  The rock is shaded in the morning and early evening.  Hikers on the Red Dot Trail are visible, but they won't notice you.  There are lots of blueberries and some wineberries in the area, and a blackberry bush at the top of the climb.
